tweets.text:
Don‚Äôt feed a fatberg this festive season-when hot fat, oil & grease cools it forms a solid mass which can build up inside pipes. Leave them to cool then scrape into the food waste or bin instead. 
 
Blocked pipes can cause flooding & pollute our beautiful beaches & countryside https://t.co/0li5vuFJIb

@WestcountryWide Looking lovely üòä any updates as to what caused the river Yelalm to turn white on November 18th or is the usual case the EA are investigating so can‚Äôt offer any information in case it jeopardises the case & then a year later we discover no prosecution @theriverstrust @EnvAgency https://t.co/Gy33InggfX

@RBWMsupport @EnvAgencySE I've tweeted @EnvAgencySE but they've not responded. Can there not be a bit more of a collaboration in the interests of the environment? I'd hate to think there's some sort of stalemate. What about the owner of the boat???
Out to sea ~ Yealm Estuary #Devon #Coastal #sea #boats #yachts #water #nature https://t.co/mMuoUmIrs9

tweets.text:
Don't feed a festive #fatberg this #Christmas. For every million turkeys we cook, around 250 tonnes of fats could go down the sink.
 
Leftover cooking fats can create blockages & increase the risk of sewer #flooding 

Instead leave to cool & scrape into the food waste or bin. https://t.co/C1bTG5mxiR

urls.description: Your one stop website for up to date information about flooding, weather and traffic disruptions across the Borough of Calderdale.

tweets.text:
Mytholmroyd‚Äôs ¬£41m new flood defences are winter-ready‚Äô. 

Our flood risk adviser Paul Swales says they will better protect over 400 homes & businesses. ‚Å¶@Calderdale‚Å© #PrepareActProtect 

https://t.co/RBitmIoj0p https://t.co/rBzgThAoac

River Yare at Thuxton looking horrendous after a bit of rain. Mud coming from fields & building sites - mostly preventable.  Shocking DIY grups straight into the main channel (Highways?) making it much worse @N_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgencyAnglia @NENorfolkSufflk @YareWildlife https://t.co/4OnuMWJ0lN

@offy_bromley @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets You are correct, it is not rocket science, it is catchment science. Dredging rivers onto banks will not stop flooding.
The #Thames looking quite placid as over 120 tons of it a second passes The Brocas  #Eton #Windsor https://t.co/9qI3X923dN

@YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Approx 25yrs ago all the rivers/canals were constantly dredged and the gunge was put up on the banks to build them up higher. This year I noticed the same canal was down to about 4‚Äô deep from around 9‚Äô. It‚Äôs not rocket science dredge rivers onto banks stop flooding
The helicopter has arrived and ballast is now being dropped in to the Canal to try and stem the flow from the breach. @CRTYorkshireNE @EnvAgencyYNE @kiergroup @ERfloodrisk https://t.co/NZ7bhmAVg4
@berecca83 Hello, thanks for the report. Unfortunately this is not something we can manage since it is in the river. Perhaps @EnvAgencySE may be able to help?

Flooding can happen at any time.
 
This festive period, check out four things you can do to protect yourself, your family, and your home.
 
 üëâhttps://t.co/PzDbHFZ82f
 
 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/2FDmubSMLz

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
We still have a number of #flood warnings/alerts active across the #Midlands. Keep checking your flood risk. 

https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/zbMlw3Qpq8
@ilkleyIain @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @CleanIlkley @Addingham_Group @YorkDalesRT Do they need to be?
Another really important step to build Calderdale's #resilience by protecting homes and businesses. @EnvAgencyYNE #visioncdale2024 https://t.co/WIOMo3K42M

Following the breach on the Aire & Calder Navigation, a helicopter is on site & moving 100 one-tonne bags of stone into the breach hole. The Trust team will then make the repair watertight with clay. 

Overnight, the flow of water leaving the navigation has slowed considerably. https://t.co/HxIZncufUY

tweets.text:
Great video from the @CoalAuthority & the @EnvAgency about their great work on old metal mines to remove polluting metals from rivers.

https://t.co/xdQV282TV7

It nicely demonstrates the importance of holding all industries accountable for restoration

@The_RRC @EAGeomorphology

Rather oddly Gov's press release doesn't make a single mention of the local community group, @CleanIlkley who's idea this was and who's achievement this actually is.

Why would that be @pow_rebecca @EnvAgency @NFUtweets @YorksWildlife @YorkshireWater?

https://t.co/7tsiP8dU5w

tweets.text:
Congratulations! Let's push for many other rivers to get bathing water status, including the #Thames through #Oxford. @outdoorswimming @thameswater @EnvAgency @OxfordCity 

Yorkshire swimming spot to get bathing water status in UK first https://t.co/jz2llTcToD

@OpenWaterAdvice @CanalRiverTrust @YWHelp @YorksWildlife @EnvAgencyYNE Hello,

How can I help?

I cant see the question unfortunately.

Thanks
Caroline

How much would you be willing to pay for your #Christmas dinner? If you pour leftover fat down the sink, it might end up costing you more than you think! @unblocktober @EnvAgency @LanesForDrains @YorkshireWater @NorthumbrianH2O @unitedutilities @stwater @thameswater https://t.co/lUZE8SUgJs

tweets.text: With @EnvAgencySE #floodalert still in place on the #EasternYar and @metoffice #weatherwarning from tomorrow, some #IsleofWight residents are being warned of possible property flooding #iwnews #iow Details: https://t.co/bkdgovrsYU https://t.co/2d1lpxkhEe

Fancy doing a fully funded @LivUni flowonthego PhD?

This will start in February with @GeomorphologyDr & @highamjonny 

Get in touch ASAP...

https://t.co/IyaNf5ZB5q

@livunigeog @fyfluiddynamics @floodinnovation @EnvAgency
@CanalRiverTrust @YWHelp @bradfordmdc @YorksWildlife @EnvAgencyYNE. Can you please answer the above question?

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK And now the @EnvAgency will have to start properly regulating the water industry, at least on that stretch of the River Wharfe.

That too will be a first.

For every one million turkeys we cook, around 250 tonnes of fats could be poured down the sink. 

Leftover cooking fats can harden in cold pipes and create blockages, increasing the risk of sewer flooding.  

Instead leave to cool, then scrape into the bin. https://t.co/x4S4yCfeUE

tweets.text: @sydsimpson @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @CleanIlkley @Addingham_Group @YorkDalesRT Definitely! Positive step though and making change involves everyone
@KirstyBreaks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @CleanIlkley @Addingham_Group @YorkDalesRT I wager none of the people on that photo are from Ilkley though Kirsty.
@KirstyBreaks @bradfordmdc @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater @CleanIlkley @Addingham_Group @YorkDalesRT Great news! - although challenging meeting the requirements.
@OpenWaterAdvice We've just seen the news! It's not a river we look after, so unfortunately we can't say. A good question to ask though

Five years on from Storm Eva: flood defence schemes, including @LeedsFAS, are bringing hope as part of city‚Äôs response against climate emergency @EnvAgencyYNE @bradfordmdc @BAMNuttall @growth_neyh @AECOM @MottMacDonald 

https://t.co/BIGei24Ohj

tweets.text: Andy from our #Worcestershire field team has just reported a boat up against the main Bridge in #Worcester town centre. Presume it has broke from its mooring upstream because the car-parks are not that expensive!!! @EnvAgencyMids @WorcsTravel @myworcester https://t.co/01eXIVFfW2

tweets.text:
A quick update from the #AireAndCalder Canal Breach.

Yesterday the @EnvAgencyYNE have assisted partners with #mapping, #drones & #UltraHighVolumePumps.

These pumps are pretty complex to install, each section of pipe weighs 75kg & we‚Äôve got 150m of pipe deployed! https://t.co/PkCmvUZ5L2

tweets.text: @offy_bromley @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @YorksWildlife @bradfordmdc @YorkDalesRT @CLAtweets Canals are managed and maintained by various navigation Authorities not YW. Rivers and flood management is done by the EA. This is about water quality so that the river is clean for wildlife and swimming.

2020 saw our works beneath Botcherby Bridge in #Carlisle being successfully completed

Flood embankments & wall raising in Melbourne Park reached the target defence height

Better protecting 1200 homes & businesses this #Christmas a great achievement despite challenges this year https://t.co/UHIdYewc3m

tweets.text: @DoncasterDamian @EnvAgencyYNE Thanks Damian, likewise to your teams from @MyDoncaster. It was a welcome surprise to bump into the familiar faces of Kyle and a couple of his colleagues üëå
@pertinaxone Hi Jason, nurdles are pre-production pellets that are used in plastics manufacture to create products made of plastic.

@EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK Why do we have to wait until 2021 for this? Clean river water should be the norm and a priority for @EnvAgency all along. That @EmmaHowardBoyd trumpets this says all you need to know about the terrible job her agency has done for the last decade
